block.p: Princeton Video Image, a company that inserts computer-generated images like signs and logos into television programs, is expanding to streaming video for computer users with agreements with two Internet companies.
Princeton Video is to describe today details of the agreements, with Real Networks and Engage Inc., part of CMGI Inc. The goal is to insert interactive, individualized images into streaming video.

Princeton Video Image, a company that inserts computer-generated images like signs and logos into television programs, is expanding to streaming video for computer users with agreements with two Internet companies.
Princeton Video is to describe today details of the agreements, with Real Networks and Engage Inc., part of CMGI Inc. The goal is to insert interactive, individualized images into streaming video.
For example, clicking onto a ''virtual'' product could produce price and ordering information without leaving the program.
The interactive images will be provided through a service that Princeton Video is calling iPoint; plans call for iPoint to start as soon as the fourth quarter.
